Key Match Events: Anthony Davis scored 37 points in 39 minutes despite the Lakers' loss.
The Lakers suffered their worst loss of the 2024-25 season, falling to the Pistons 115-103.
The Pistons led by as many as 20 points during the game.
Anthony Davis re-aggravated an injury late in the fourth quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Davis expressed frustration with the team's inconsistent performance, stating, 'We're just two different teams right now.'
Davis mentioned the need for the Lakers to play a full 48 minutes to be successful.
Davis discussed his ongoing injury issues and the uncertainty of his status moving forward.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers' bench scoring and transition defense were highlighted as significant weaknesses.
The Pistons scored 28 bench points, 58 points inside the paint, and 22 second-chance opportunities.
The Lakers rank last in the league in bench scoring and fast-break points allowed, and 25th in defensive rating.
